data.title: Film + Horror films
data.text:
28 Weeks Later, the terrifying sequel to Danny Boyle's apocalyptic hit about zombies roaming the empty streets of London, has distinctly modern relevance. But, says Mark Kermode, it joins a brilliant tradition of British horrors that turn familiar sights into killing fields.

Philip French: ... a third-rate Wes Craven horror production made in South Africa and set on a deserted island off the North American coast

Gillian Anderson's latest returns to the subject matter of 70s B-movies like Last House on the Left. Is this a fit topic for entertainment?

Philip French: A bad time is had by all as The Exorcist meets The Wicker Man in America's Deep South.
